byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Christina Capecchi from Richfield, Minn.; Katharine Q. Seelye from Chelsea, Mass.; Jess Bidgood from Boston; Richard Fausset from Decatur, Ga.; Nicholas Fandos from Leesburg, Va.; and David Montgomery from Austin, Tex.

abstract: Many Democratic voters in 11 states on Super Tuesday say they voted for Hillary Rodham Clinton despite her trust issues; some had considered supporting Sen Bernie Sanders, but went with inevitability of Clinton's candidacy.
lead_paragraph: After entertaining Mr. Sanders’s insurgency for months, Democrats seem ready to restore to the Clinton candidacy the air of inevitability with which she began her campaign.

headline.main: Democrats Turn to Hillary Clinton After Flirting With Bernie Sanders
headline.print_headline: Voters Turn to Clinton After Flirting With Sanders

snippet: After entertaining Mr. Sanders’s insurgency for months, Democrats seem ready to restore to the Clinton candidacy the air of inevitability with which she began her campaign.
